artworks.title: St Michael
artworks.description: Centrepiece of a unique Victorian installation of plaster models, this sculpture of the archangel battling his foe is the final masterpiece of this acclaimed artist.
artworks.location: Centre of Flaxman Gallery, UCL Main Library

artworks.title: The Lord’s Prayer: Deliver us from Evil Monument to the Baring Family
artworks.description: A believer that angels safeguard the individual, Flaxman shows two angels rescuing a man from the clutches of serpents and falling demons.
artworks.location: Centre of middle row, NE wall, Flaxman Gallery

artworks.title: A Brahmin and a Mohammedan in Earnest Converse for their Country’s Good
artworks.description: The marble monument to Major General Sir Barry Close made from this model is in Madras, demonstrating Flaxman’s international fame.
artworks.location: Bottom left corner, SW wall, Flaxman Gallery

artworks.title: The Four Founders of UCL
artworks.description: Mural by a Slade professor to celebrate UCL’s centenary. Depicts a fictional meeting between Jeremy Bentham, Lord Brougham, Thomas Campbell, Henry Crabb Robinson and the architect to discuss Wilkins Building plans.

artworks.title: The Nativity
artworks.description: In this student prize work by one of Britain’s visionary 20th-century painters the artist’s mature style is instantly recognisable, the monumentality of his figures influenced by post-impressionism and Italian primitivism.
artworks.location: South wall, Housman Room, North Cloisters

artworks.title: Under Milk Wood
artworks.description: This prize-winning Slade painting shows three strong women gossiping in a Portuguese kitchen, anticipating the dominant female characters in the artist’s later work.
artworks.location: North wall of Housman Room, North Cloisters, Wilkins Building

artworks.title: Female Figure
artworks.description: Works like this prize-winner by Carrington resulted from the Slade’s pioneering policy allowing women to draw from life.
artworks.location: East wall of Housman Room, North Cloisters, Wilkins Building

artworks.title: Marmor Homericum
artworks.description: The inhabitants of Delos listen as Homer recites the Iliad in this work commissioned by George Grote, one of UCL’s founders.
artworks.location: North wall, South Cloisters, Wilkins Building

artworks.title: A Prospect of the City of Rome
artworks.description: This vast panorama of Rome, composed of 6 plates, would have had pride of place in a 18th-century gentleman’s library.
artworks.location: Top of east wall, UCL Art Museum, South Cloisters, Wilkins Building

artworks.title: Rustic Scene
artworks.description: he Times claimed this large-scale work by the student artist and ‘Bright Young Thing’ heralded the revival of mural painting.
artworks.location: Opposite staircase between ground and 1st floors, Foster Court
